intro: Viguiera veredensis, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces showy purple to pink flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Viguiera veredensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in arid conditions with minimal water requirements.
